title: GitHubPlugin/Development/BrowserConsole
text:
You can access the plugin's library functions which encapsulate all access to the GitHub API from the browser console as `$tw.utils.github`.

; Example: Access the plugin object

```javascript
var github = $tw.modules.execute('$:/plugins/ustuehler/github')
```

; Example: Get a user's profile data

```javascript
github.getUserProfile('ustuehler')
  .then(function(profile) {
    console.log(profile)
  })
```

; Example: Sign in with access token

```javascript
github.signIn(accessToken)
  .then(function(user) {
    console.log('Signed in as ' + user.login + '.')
  })
```

; Example: List the signed-in user's repositories

```javascript
github.getUserRepos()
  .then(function(repos) {
    console.log('Retrieved ' + repos.length + ' repositories.')
  })
```

title: GitHubPlugin/Development/SignInButton
text:
{{$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/ui/SignIn}}

The button above creates an ActionSendMessageWidget with `tm-github-sign-in` as its `$message` attribute. The handler for this message is installed by the [[startup module|$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/modules/startup.js]].

title: GitHubPlugin/Development/Startup
text:
The plugin's [[startup|$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/modules/startup.js]] module gets executed after the core's [[miscellaneous startup logic|Startup]].

This means that other parts of this plugin could already be executing as well, unless care is taken. Therefore, ''I don't want UI components to call plugin code directly''; they should rely entirely on event handling and messaging.

[[Next|GitHubPlugin/SignIn]]

title: GitHubPlugin/Development/SyncAdaptor
text:
The ''<<edit-tiddler-link to:"$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/lib/githubadaptor.js" text:"githubadaptor">>'' module of the GitHubPlugin is an implementation of a SyncAdaptor. It synchronises changed tiddlers with a repository on GitHub.

The current implementation has used the [[tiddlywebadaptor|$:/plugins/tiddlywiki/tiddlyweb/tiddlywebadaptor.js]] module from TiddlyWiki5 as a reference.

title: GitHubPlugin/Development/WriteFileButton
text: The {{||$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/Buttons/write-file}} button <<edit-tiddler-link to:"$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/Buttons/write-file" text:"(source)">> uploads the current tiddler to GitHub.

title: GitHubPlugin/OAuthLogin
text: The login feature was to be provided by the OAuthPlugin, but now the FirebasePlugin is used to handle the OAuth flow and to store GitHub credentials, instead.

title: GitHubPlugin/ObtainingClientCredentials
text: New Application View Applications

title: GitHubPlugin/SignInWithOAuth
text: ''This flow is incomplete.'' Follow the new sign-in flow described in [[GitHubPlugin/SignIn]]. <$github-signin> Signing in with your GitHub account lets you synchronize your changes with the GitRepository. ''Step 1: Obtain a client ID and secret'' {{GitHubPlugin/ObtainingClientCredentials}} ''Step 2: Set client ID and secret for this application'' <$button to="OAuthSettings" class="mdc-button mdc-button--raised" style="color: white;" >Open Settings ''Step 3: Sign in with your ~GitHub account'' {{$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/Buttons/sign-in}}

title: GitHubPlugin/Tests/WriteFile
text:
\define signedIn()
[[$:/status/GitHub]field:signed-in[true]]
\end
\define signedOut()
[[$:/status/GitHub]field:signed-in[false]]
\end
\define openFileOnGitHub(path:"" file:"")
<$macrocall $name="github-blob-button"
  org={{$:/config/GitHub/Org}}
  repo={{$:/config/GitHub/Repo}}
  branch={{$:/config/GitHub/Branch}}
  file="$path$/$file$"/>
\end

''Given'' the user is signed in

{{GitHubPlugin/SignIn}}

<$list variable="" filter=<<signedIn>>>

''And'' the tiddler repository location is configured as

{{GitHubPlugin/SyncSettings}}

''When'' the user activates the button

{{Test||$:/plugins/ustuehler/github/Buttons/write-file}}

''Then'' the tiddler <<currenTiddler>> appears on ~GitHub

<$macrocall $name="openFileOnGitHub"
  path={{$:/config/GitHub/Path}}
  file="Test.tid"/>

</$list>
